results.title: Frontend Developer
results.description:
At Mimo, we believe that coding can open doors to careers and opportunities like few other skills. That's why we've rallied around the common goal of making coding universally accessible.

 

We're looking for a frontend developer to join our cross-functional Bootcamp team. You will be responsible for developing features that will shape our brand-new product, helping us become the largest tech school and helping millions more to learn to code.

 

What you’ll be doing

  • You’ll design, build, and ship major user-facing engagement features in collaboration with product managers, designers, and developers, using JavaScript, TypeScript, and React.
  • You’ll apply a component-driven approach, using React, Nextjs, Storybookjs, and XState in the process.
  • You’ll own features end-to-end, from planning and implementing, to shipping and optimizing.
  • You’ll drive business impact by securing a smooth page speed and a high site performance.



You’ll thrive in this role if

  • You’re a seasoned developer. You have multiple years of experience as a developer shipping features for large-scale and real-time applications building consumer-facing products, and actively helping others to improve.
  • You’re a product-minded engineer. You’ll foster this mindset by sharing knowledge and ideas and challenging what’s already there.
  • You bring excellent attention to detail. You’ll put our learners first when reasoning trade-offs while caring deeply about close attention to detail.
  • You care about code quality. You follow engineering best practices like code reviews to ensure and maintain excellent application performance and code quality.
  • You're passionate about creating fast, smooth, and user-friendly web experiences. You have a keen eye for web performance and a solid understanding of Core Web Vitals.
  • You have a sense of ownership. You believe in solving a problem entirely rather than simply shipping a solution. You operate autonomously and follow through on your commitments.

 

How we work

  • We’re a distributed team working between the time zones of Eastern Standard Time (UTC -6) and Eastern European Time (UTC +2) for collaboration. For this role, we ask you to be located adjacent to Eastern European Time (UTC +0 to UTC +2).
  • If you’re located outside this time zone range and want to move to the company’s official headquarters in Austria, we’ll handle the work permit process and cover travel expenses.
  • If you prefer to work outside your home, we offer a physical location in Vienna and co-working stipends in other cities.
  • We love working async. You can set your own pace and schedule.

 

Our global perks and benefits

  • We have a remote-first mentality and give everyone a home-office budget.
  • 25 days of paid vacation in addition to your local public holidays and paid sick leave.
  • We sponsor team retreats throughout Europe and remote-friendly activities, like hack weeks and coffee breaks.
  • To further develop yourself, use our €1k growth budget for books, online courses, conferences, or anything else that supports your development.
  • To give our menstruating team members the time off to cater to their health when needed during their menstrual cycle, we offer up to 2 days of paid menstrual leave per month.
  • Your annual gross salary is €61k, which will automatically increase by 5% yearly. No questions asked.
  • The chance to build a world-class product, positively impact millions of aspiring developers, and be a virtual owner of the company with equity (phantom stock).

 

About us

With the Mimo app, we've made it easy and fun for more than 15 million beginners to start coding on the go and build up their confidence to pursue a career in tech. From bite-size coding exercises to full-fledged projects, we’re helping our learners form a habit of coding and reach university-level learning outcomes. And with the launch of cohort-based programs, we’re well on our way toward becoming the world’s largest tech school. If you, too, want to help millions of people learn to code and eventually become developers, this is your opportunity to shape the future of tech education.

 

Our 4-step hiring process, in a nutshell

  • You’ll first have a video call with a member of the People team for a quick get-to-know chat.
  • Then, you’ll be given a take-home challenge to work on. Don’t worry; we know you have many things on your plate and good things take time. You won’t be given a deadline.
  • Next up is the technical interview to show off your skills to the hiring manager.
  • Lastly, you’ll meet your potential future peers for a laid-back conversation.
  • If everything goes silky smooth, you’d be receiving an offer from us shortly after. Fingers crossed!

results.title: Cloud Engineer
results.description:
Company Description

This position is eligible to work 100% remotely unless residing in the following states: AL, CA, CT, HI, IN, KY, MD, MA, NH, NJ, NY, ND, OH, OR, PA, RI, VT, VA, WA, WY

Ent Credit Union exists to improve the financial quality of life of the people we serve. This mission drives us every day, but we are more than our mission. 

We’re also individuals using our unique abilities to make our organization, and the communities we serve, better than they were yesterday. We’re a not-for-profit that puts people above profits and actively invests in our community. Our rapidly growing team is expanding our reach to serve more people throughout Colorado. 

To spread our mission far and wide, we need people like you. If you’re interested in a paycheck with a purpose, apply with us today. Our people make the difference and, though it sounds cliché, we truly believe you are our greatest asset. 



Job Description

A versatile Cloud Engineer, possessing strong design, migration, administration, and support experience in Microsoft Azure and Infrastructure cloud / infrastructure services. This position continually works to transition current processes to a cloud-first strategy as a cloud services expert, both individually and part of a team.

Essential Functions:

  • Tactical Cloud Support / Maintenance Activities: Provision, configure, administrate, automate, monitor, and support enterprise Cloud services. Through automation, enforce continuous compliance to operation and security standards. Perform operational engineering for activities which include platform upgrades, server patching, monitoring, configuration, and troubleshooting. Provide periodic off-hours on-call support for production and development environments. Manage security logging, monitoring, and alert triage and participate in security incident response and investigation.
  • Strategic Cloud /Automation Development & Guidance: Assist with enterprise datacenter modernization initiative by researching, designing, recommending, and implementing an Azure cloud infrastructure which supports global business applications and operations. Assist in the development of processes and practices as it relates to the migration of workloads to Azure. Assist in the design state-of-the-art technical solutions on Azure that are scalable, reliable, secure, and meet performance requirements. Support architectural design and new cloud service implementations utilizing industry best practices. Assist with the planning and migration of legacy applications to the Azure Cloud. May assist other team members with questions related to cloud services
  • Bank Secrecy Act: Remains cognizant of and adheres to Ent policies and procedures, and regulations pertaining to the Bank Secrecy Act.


Qualifications

​​​​​​Minimum Formal Education for this position:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical field.

Minimum Work Experience for this position:

  • 4+ years' combined technical IT related experience to include at least:
  • 2+ years' experience in infrastructure / general data center operations.


All degrees listed are considered to be "knowledge consistent with?. Each year of equivalent work experience may be exchanged for 1 year in a relevant degree program or vice versa. For example, 4+ years of required accounting experience could be substituted for an associate's degree and 2+ years of work experience.

Technical or Specialized Knowledge/ Skills:

  • Knowledge in Azure and VMware virtual environments.
  • Basic understanding of Microsoft Azure product and services suite of products and their applicable use cases, best practices, implementation, and support considerations.
  • Basic understanding of Azure platform and network security.
  • Basic understanding of Azure identity and access management.
  • Knowledge of Azure backup and disaster recovery processes using tools such as Azure backup and ASR.
  • Practical understanding of scripting tools and Cloud automation.
  • Able to write and maintain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks.
  • Novice coding in JSON.
  • Experience with Azure and IAM security policies.
  • Ensure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability.
  • Strong interpersonal skills used in developing strong working relationships and effective listening skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent decision-making, problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities.
  • Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (eg. GDPR, HIPAA, SOX, etc.).
  • Experience with on-premise datacenter technologies (Hyper-V, S2D, ESX, etc.).
  • (preferred) Network skills.

Certifications Required:

  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate, Microsoft MCSA: Cloud Platform, Microsoft MCSE: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure, Microsoft MCSA: Linux on Azure, ISC2 Certified Cloud Security Professional, TOGAF 9 Certification or other related industry certification. Preferred

Environmental, Physical and Psychological Requirements:

  • Standing - Occasionally
  • Walking - Occasionally

  • Lifting - Rarely (40 Lbs)
  • Carrying - Rarely

Additional Information

The salary range for this position: $80,475 - $116,188.80 (I15)

This position is eligible for our corporate bonus program based on company performance.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Benefits Summary Sheet - 2023

results.title: SR. BUSINESS ANALYST
results.description:
More Than Just A Job, We Offer An Opportunity To Grow! Our project team is exploring to recruiting a Business Analyst to build a future in Reiz Tech!
Reiz Tech is Expanding and Hiring Globally! Growth Is In Our DNA and We Will Help You Grow!


ABOUT THE ROLE

 

The Business Analyst works with stakeholders from crucial business and technical units to understand business needs and priorities, help choose the best solution option, and define requirements for solutions that deliver value. This role requires the individuals to act as an intermediary between stakeholder groups and ensure that business requirements are met when building IT solutions.

 

 

 

ABOUT THE CLIENT

 

One of the biggest financial institutions in Lithuania.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Establish strong working relationships with stakeholders, both business and technical (e.g. developers, solution architects, and UX/UI designers).

  • Gather information from stakeholders and other sources to specify and model requirements.

  • Analyze the requirements’ dependencies, and maintain requirements’ traceability to product goals and solution components.

  • Communicate requirements and potential value to developers and stakeholders.

  • Create and maintain the Product Backlog, and support the Product Owner to build a Product Roadmap.

  • Support Quality Assurance Specialists to ensure the overall quality of the solution.

  • Participate in Scrum ceremonies.

  • Agree and develop a minimal level of solution documentation.

 

  • Strong ability to communicate with business and IT representatives at all levels of the organization.

  • Ability to elicit, isolate and interpret business needs.

  • Knowledge of techniques to design requirements and skills to choose appropriate ones.

  • Experience capturing requirements for complex IT solutions within a compliance-oriented environment.

  • Understanding the software development lifecycle, especially Agile software development.

  • Ability to balance priorities among competing needs.

  • Curiosity and willingness to learn.

  • Ability to communicate well in both English and Lithuanian languages.

 

ADVANTAGES

  • Experience working in financial or fintech organizations.

  • Tertiary or vendor-aligned technical qualifications covering general business analysis (e.g. University IT or Business degree, certification, e.g. PMI-PBA, CBAP).

  • Understanding the database concepts.

  • Ability to read and interpret XML and XSD documents.

results.title: Sr. Business Analyst, AEM
results.description:
Location: Anywhere USA

TA Digital is a digital transformation agency with 30-40% growth year-over-year focused on hiring leaders within the digital marketing space to support growth and build a scalable foundation for the future. Our vision is to provide innovative digital solutions and services by continuing to expand our leadership team and hiring superstars who may feel lost or marginalized within their current organizations.

If you feel:

  • there are too many layers between you and decision makers
  • that your current organization will not make the right decision even after you identify problems and recommend viable solutions
  • you are ready for a bigger voice, larger platform or place for a stronger impact

…then you should consider TA Digital because we are ready to talk to you!

Description:

The Sr. Business Analyst (AEM) is a highly motivated individual with strong technical and communication skills who leverages data to create impactful analysis and reporting to help inform strategic initiatives. The ideal candidate will be able to work collaboratively across a diverse team to gather business requirements and conduct process mapping to facilitate the documentation and automation of product and system requirements. This is a dynamic role in a growth organization with direct exposure to corporate strategy and will work closely with Business, UX, Development, QA and Off-Shore resources as a thought partner daily.

Responsibilities:

  • Obtains the big picture of the product and release vision
  • Understand current business processes and define future business processes
  • Work with multiple simultaneous projects by identifying requirements, facilitating change management, impact analysis, supporting execution team
  • Client engagement:
  • Engage stakeholders, facilitate workshops, conduct client interviews to define business goals and elicit business requirements
  • Prioritize requirements collaboratively with business stakeholders, UX and technology disciplines
  • Define and document business requirements, functional requirements and process flows/ modelling
  • Determine documentation needs based on the project requirements and manage the documentation efforts
  • Collaborate with Creative team and ensure that User Experience and Visual Design align with Functional Requirements
  • Provide requirement inputs during technical design sessions, review design deliverables for consistency and as a source of requirements
  • Ensure that project team has clear understanding of functional requirements and business expectations
  • Work with QA teams to develop testing strategy, test plan, identify test cases and participate in UAT
  • Conduct training session for a product or an implementation
  • Create product documentation and training material including user manuals

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree required (Business or Digital Marketing) Master's degree (preferred)
  • Experience working in the digital agency or consulting firm space
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience as Business Analyst, Functional Analyst or Proxy Product Owner
  • An agile BA with a strategic, functional, technical and relationship focused approach
  • Experience working with cross functional teams in transition projects with competitor vendors
  • Ability in working with both onsite and offshore teams in distributed agile
  • Familiar with use of collaborative tools preferably confluence
  • Experience in platforms for Content Management
  • Can work with multiple integration points for a technology stack:
    • WCM/CMS Adobe: AEM required
    • Adobe Analytics, Target, Audience Manager, DAM is a strong plus
    • SFMC (Salesforce Marketing Cloud / Exact Target), SEO is beneficial
  • Understanding of templates, components and authoring requirements in a CMS
  • Advanced understanding of Site SEO requirements, benchmarking and audit in stage and live environments.
  • Great communication and interpersonal skills and stakeholder management
  • Good research, product demo and presentation skills

Benefits

Compensation:

The salary range listed is for informational purposes. TA Digital treats all applicants as individuals taking into consideration but not limited to their professional and academic experience, specialized training, certifications and associated responsibilities as it relates to our specific industry. The salary range listed is just one component of our total compensation package for each unique employee. An estimated base salary of $115K – $150K plus a variable component is anticipated for this role in the US.

Benefits: Global Health, Dental, Vision, AD&D Insurance, Vacation / PTO / Holiday pay plus matching 401K, Tuition & Travel Expense Reimbursement as needed

About us:

TA Digital is the only global boutique agency that delivers the “best of both worlds” to clients seeking to achieve organizational success through digital transformation. Unlike smaller, regional agencies that lack the ability to scale or large organizations that succumb to a quantity-over-quality approach, we offer resource diversity while also providing meticulous attention to the details that enable strategic success.

Over the past 20 years, TA Digital has positioned clients to achieve digital maturity by focusing on data, customer-centricity and exponential return on investment; by melding exceptional user experience and data-driven methodologies with artificial intelligence and machine learning, we enable digital transformations that intelligently build upon the strategies we set into motion. We are known as a global leader that assists marketing and technology executives in understanding the digital ecosystem while identifying cultural and operational gaps within their business - ultimately ushering organizations toward a more mature model and profitable digital landscape.

Recognized in 2013, 2014, 2015, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 Inc. 5000 list as one of the most successful technology companies in the United States, TA Digital is pleased also to share high-level strategic partnerships with world class digital experience platform companies like Adobe, SAP and Salesforce and possess global partnerships with industry leaders such as Sitecore, Episerver, Elastic Path, BigCommerce, AWS, Azure and Coveo.

TA Digital has offices in US, Canada, UK and India. For more information, visit: www.tadigital.com

EOE & OFCCP Compliant regardless of: Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / National Origin

Apply Here: https://apply.workable.com/ta-digital/j/5C26038E03/

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Treasury Prime is the leading Banking as a Service (BaaS) company that connects banks and fintechs through an API so developers can start building in minutes and launch in days. Treasury Prime’s full integration into core banking systems gives developers access to a wide range of banking services, from opening accounts to making payments to issuing cards. Treasury Prime is backed by Deciens Capital, Nyca Partners, QED Investors, SaaStr Fund, Susa Ventures, and Y Combinator.

Treasury Prime is building a bank partnerships team to engage potential chartered bank partners to offer BaaS products through the Treasury Prime platform. Apply for this role if you want to be an early member and help shape the bank team’s growth, direction, and culture. You'll have executive exposure at Treasury Prime, build the processes to nurture inbound and outbound opportunities, learn about new business models from our fintech and bank clients, and how to build a company directly from a team of serial entrepreneurs.

Account Executive - Banks

You will: 

  • Help develop and execute inbound and outbound partner strategies to create and nurture opportunities

  • Manage the complete partnership cycle from lead to close for bank partners

  • Build and own lead generation and targeted acquisition strategy for bank capacity to match fintech pipeline

  • Own a named account list and develop plans for winning and expanding business with bank partners

  • Develop relationships with executive stakeholders at potential banks

  • Lead and contribute to team projects to develop and refine our bank integrations

  • Engage with product and engineering teams to help drive strategy

You may be a good fit for this role if: 

  • Deep understanding of the highly regulated banking industry and the ability to relate it to the complex technical requirements of our fintech partners 

  • Ability to develop and execute partnership plans spanning multiple banks and fintechs

  • Strong presentation skills for both virtual and in-person meetings with various stakeholders

  • Proven ability to interact and articulate complex solutions to all levels of a banking organization - from CEOs and chairpersons of boards to operations and compliance managers

  • Superior verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to operate in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment

  • Strong interest in the intersection of technology and financial services

While these are not hard requirements for the job, the best candidates will meet many of these criteria. 

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

Treasury Prime is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please get in touch with careers@treasuryprime.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. Our team will respond to your email promptly.

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Are you ready for a new way of working? Automox is launching organizations into the future with cloud-native IT operations. By ditching clunky legacy tools and automating soul-crushing manual tasks, IT admins can get back to more exciting, strategic work. Behind our effortlessly modern platform is a group of builders, innovators, and entrepreneurial thinkers breaking the status quo–and having a lot of fun doing it. Our award winning culture, values, and community are shaped by real people doing really extraordinary work. 
 
Ditch your daily commute, say goodbye to the typical nine-to-five, and embrace a new way of working at Automox.
 
OVERVIEW
 
At the heart of our work here at Automox is to raise the world's security confidence. We are seeking a results-driven Account Executive to join our world-class team. You will evangelize our modern security patching cloud platform to prospective customers. This role requires self-motivated individuals and great teammates who are passionate about SaaS and leading the end-to-end sales cycle. Successful candidates will have demonstrated the ability to identify and bring in new business with their outstanding knowledge of the product and the customer base of IT and Security Ops managers.  Technical conversations and demos have become a critical part of our successful process.



THE FUN STUFF
  • Drive Automox’s new business revenue growth.
  • Exceed monthly sales revenue targets while contributing to overall team goals.
  • Maintain customer database integrity, maintain complete/accurate records of sales activity in support system of record and individual follow up systems/processes.
  • Bring a great attitude as we develop a new team and all the fun that comes with building a great sales and overall company culture.



WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
  • 3-7 years of experience hunting and closing new business sales in the software security industry or equivalent
  • Self-starter, proactive, motivated, responsible with a passion for customer engagement
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, professional and confident phone/email skills
  • Ability to work toward common goals in a self-directed team environment with minimal supervision
  • Comfortable with, and enjoy, a challenging sale, helping IT Managers and decision-makers see value in evolving their approach to security
  • Possess an affinity for SaaS with technical aptitude to convey/articulate value-based propositions to a technical audience, including C-level
  • Demonstrated track record of meeting and exceeding quota
  • You have the ability to work cross-functionally, lead projects, and make things happen

COMPENSATION
Our salary ranges are based on national averages and are determined based on the level of the position we are hiring for. The ranges are wide to leave room for variability in a candidate's skills, experience, and location all which impact where someone might come in on the range. Minimum base salary - $80,000 on a 50/50 split.

Automox is the cloud-native IT operations platform for modern organizations. Our award-winning answer to modern IT operations and best-in-class results earned Automox four straight quarters of record growth. We are now trusted by more than 2,500 leading companies and MSPs worldwide, including NASA, Yale, Xerox, Allbirds, and Unicef. It makes it easy to keep every endpoint automatically configured, patched, and secured – anywhere in the world. The future of IT Operations is cloud-native – and right now. Will you join us?

results.title: Senior Marketing & Communications Manager
results.description:
A career at constellr is for those who are seeking the extraordinary. We are operating in the new space and agri-tech sectors, combining engineering, Earth Observation and agronomy to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: how to ensure global food security.

We are a fast-growing team of more than a dozen highly motivated engineers, scientists, and business professionals with a shared vision to rebase decision making in tomorrow’s smart farming industry. ConstellR has offices in the European capital, Brussels, situated between the attractive Etterbeek and Watermael districts and in beautiful Freiburg, in south west Germany, bordering the Black Forest and in close proximity to France and Switzerland.

 

The role

‍We are searching for an analytical, creative and highly motivated marketing professional with a track record in delivering successful marketing campaigns and driving growth through effective product marketing and positioning. You will be up to date and enjoy learning the latest digital and product marketing tools whilst being comfortable with developing strategies for marketing high-tech products and services.

You have a passion for building a brand with purpose and developing a motivated, high-performing team who can leverage their expertise to support both brand development and inbound sales. Your role will be instrumental in driving forward the company’s international growth and positioning, both as a leading earth observation service provider but also a top place for employees to thrive and develop.

  • Research, design and deliver a product marketing strategy and plan (digital, direct, offline etc.) to support constellr’s growth and ongoing positioning in the market. You will be instrumental in designing and delivering innovative, successful campaigns.
  • Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders across the business, including in product and commercial to specific marketing objectives across different channels to ensure our marketing is well-aligned with our sales strategy.
  • Drive constellr’s employer branding strategy to help refine our product and team positioning and messaging as well as support in the standardization of communications and media materials.
  • Implement lean yet consistent and effective marketing performance, tracking and reporting processes to ensure continuous oversight, optimisation and growth.
  • Manage a network of agency partners to develop integrated materials and campaigns (briefing, providing strategic feedback, driving delivery, managing budgets and timelines).
  • Undertake audits of the market to provide competitive insight, and continually review and refresh communication strategies to ensure we stay relevant to customers and strengthen our brand equity.
  • Support in the development of content for our key social media channels as well as the company blog, media and other creative materials.
  • Ownership and optimisation of the constellr website including landing pages, SEO and other relevant content and customer engagement elements.

Your skills & experience

  • Marketing experience in an agency or in-house for a high-tech company; strong experience of technical content writing, channel and campaign management.
  • Experience of developing and running B2B marketing campaigns in European and overseas markets.
  • A long-term motivation for developing a purpose-driven global brand, which helps drive both commercial and team growth.
  • A deep understanding of digital marketing tools, products and services and a strong understanding of the use and value of marketing technology, automation and analytics.
  • A deeply collaborative person who can partner with, learn from and coach peers and junior team members. Able to engage at all levels of the organization and to represent the company externally-
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Graphic design and other relevant marketing software experience a massive plus however not essential.
  • The ability to work autonomously and analytically and be results-oriented
  • High discipline in view of the mission ahead.

What we offer you

  • Be part of a fast-growing, multidisciplinary and diverse team with a strong desire to leverage change
  • Autonomy to set and deliver against your own goals, develop new skills and capabilities and lead others to do the same
  • Directly influence your contribution to achieving several of the UN's sustainable development goals, including Zero Hunger, Clean Water, No Poverty and Climate Action
  • Contribute to bringing the world’s first commercial infrared constellation into orbit and enabling an entirely novel set of smart farming capabilities, as part of our mission to build a new biophysical atlas, driving an unprecedented understanding of our planet and its resources.
  • A competitive salary & benefits package and for some roles a remote or hybrid model. We encourage you to spend at least some time in Freiburg or Brussels with the team to bond and work on special projects.

results.title: Head of People (Maternity Cover)
results.description:
Head of People (Maternity Cover, 9 Month Fixed Term Contract)

About Titanbay

At Titanbay, we believe in the power of private market returns. Our investment platform enables institutional and private investors to invest in top-tier private equity, venture capital and real estate funds with low minimums and low fees. With our portfolio construction tools, investors can build sophisticated private equity allocations with unparalleled insight. Titanbay is run and supported by private equity professionals and industry veterans from leading companies including Oaktree, EQT, Hg, Bain, Capital Group, Blackstone and J.P. Morgan.

 

Titanbay has had a phenomenal first couple of years, bringing a selection of some of the world’s top Private Equity managers and strategies onto our platform.

 

We’re seeking to appoint a People Manager as part of a 9 Month Maternity Cover position. As Head of People you will lead an existing team and continue working towards our goal of best practice, embedding positive values and behaviours across the business.

 

What you’ll be doing:
  • Review, develop and own our HR processes and procedures including performance and employee relations issues.
  • Support the development and Growth of the People team
  • Own the entire employee lifecycle from onboarding to exit
  • Implement an effective performance appraisal system that aligns with business’ objectives and key results and encourages employees to develop and grow their careers
  • Maximise employee engagement by developing and implementing new initiatives, encouraging 360 feedback and creating an effective quarterly employee engagement survey and developing solutions to any issues that arise
  • Develop effective cross functional communications which allow ideas and suggestions to be shared
  • Build and promote our D&I initiatives alongside our Talent Team.
  • Continually strive to build a culture focused on well-being and drive and implement initiatives which support our core values.
  • Develop and deliver 1:1 sessions for managers on a variety of subjects to upskill line managers.

Requirements

  • 5 years experience as a people leader within a fast growing start-up and/or scale up environment
  • A strong understanding of team cultures and needs with the ability to identify areas of improvement
  • Experience creating and implementing robust HR processes and procedures
  • Knowledge of effectively driving D&I initiatives
  • Strong relationship-building skills with employees of all levels as well as senior leadership teams
  • Proven leadership skills with the ability to mentor and coach junior members of the team while also driving own performance
  • Prior involvement in organisational design and strategy with the ability to manage shifting priorities and work on multiple initiatives in a challenging and fast paced environment.
  • Critical thinking skills – able to balance complex situations and deliver solutions. Able to blend both established processes/procedures and creative solutions
  • High level organisational skills – able to juggle numerous workstreams and deliver to deadlines

Benefits

results.title: Data Engineer
results.description:
About us

Bankuish is a startup that helps millions of entrepreneurs and freelancers in Latin America access financial services. Our app connects gig workers with personalized loans and offers from the largest banks and institutions in the region. Together, we are helping banks better serve this niche and simultaneously helping gig workers improve their financial security.

The role

The ideal candidate for this role has a solid foundation in creating data pipelines, ETL and analytical data warehouse. She/He will be responsible for our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.

This role will support Data Scientists and Data Analysts by providing infrastructure and tools that can be used to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems.

What you will do
  • Build and automate data systems, processes, and models to help us scale our ability to evaluate gig workers, and to make financial services more accessible to millions of individuals around the world.
  • Evaluate, design, and implement analytics tools to facilitate data-driven decisions across the company.
  • Contribute to designing and building our data infrastructure. Influence the technical architecture, and help make decisions that shape the foundation of our data products.
  • Build reliable data services and robust ingestion pipelines for both structured and unstructured data sources.
  • Design and ship ETL/ELT pipelines that transform, aggregate, normalize, and master messy data.
  • Develop and automate large scale, high-performance data processing systems (batch and/or streaming).
  • Define data models for optimal storage
Responsibilities
  • Build and optimize ETL.
  • Build dashboards.
  • Develop solutions to process a large volume of data.
  • Ensure data preparation, flow, and integrity.
  • Create data models and business indicators.
Desired Skills
  • Knowledge in SQL.
  • Experience with streaming and batch pipelines.
  • Experience with python programming language.
  • Experience with ETL.
  • Knowledge in DW, dimensional modeling and data integration.
  • Degree in Information Technology desired
What Makes a Great Fit?

We believe that people do their best work when they are aligned with the mission and company goals. We're looking for an experienced professional who is self-motivated, dynamic, and great working closely with small teams. The ideal candidate believes in doing hard things by doing them together. We're looking for someone who is excited to apply their personal superpowers to serve millions of gig workers – someone who is passionate about addressing issues of financial inclusion and democratizing access to financial services.

How we Work

At Bankuish we are fully remote and widely dispersed, working from our own homes and neighborhoods across the world. We still prefer to collaborate and communicate in real-time.

results.title: Associate Product Manager
results.description:
We’re passionate marketers, engineers, and innovators building the technology to power the future of commerce. We’re a B2B SaaS platform helping the world’s most interesting retailers and direct-to-consumer brands remove friction from the customer experience to deliver recurring revenue through subscriptions programs - shifting their consumer interactions from one-and-done transactions to long-lived, highly profitable relationships.

Recent studies show that 75% of direct-to-consumer retailers will offer subscription services by 2023. Ordergroove has created the technology that will allow retailers to do this. 

Want to be a part of it? Keep reading...

Ordergroove is a dynamic, fast-paced environment where you will be involved in building something of real value from the ground-up. We're looking for bright, talented people who are excited about innovation, growth, and the exciting world of Relationship Commerce.  If you’re motivated by a desire to solve problems and deliver groundbreaking insights and solutions you’ll fit in perfectly! We are looking for someone who has worked in the mar-tech ecosystem or subscription-based companies and can bring that expertise to Ordergroove’s client base. 

At Ordergroove, we make product and company decisions based on data. Data is what drives our ability to understand our customers' businesses and their experiences with Ordergroove so we can deliver products and features that truly help them grow. Internally, data empowers cross functional teams to help drive our own success as a company. We are committed to delivering high quality data across all of our platforms and providing key analytic metrics to our external and internal users. 

The data team at Ordergroove encompasses merchant analytics, product analytics, internal analytics and more! We are looking for an Associate Product Manager to join the data team and work across these different areas. Your job will be to make data clear, relevant, easy and accessible to those who need it so that all users, internal and external, can recognize Ordergroove's impact and make impactful decisions. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Bring data pipelines and products to life, leading initiatives from discovery to launch to understanding outcomes 
  • Own the strategic plan and roadmap for analytics delivered to our merchants 
  • Understand analytics needs and user pain points to craft product vision and solutions to address them. 
  • Determine key initiatives to guide the analytics product forward, break those plans into manageable, measurable, achievable release plans.
  • Work closely with cross functional teams such as engineering, design, success and marketing to understand and shape deliverables around data needs.
  • Identify process gaps and opportunities, take on ever-increasing responsibilities. Communicate your plans and product vision to the company. Work closely with the SVP of Product & Sr Product Manager to build a world-class analytics offering.

 

About you:

  • A passion for data and an eye for detail with numbers
  • Experience with technical or analytical product subject matter (examples include but not limited to: fintech product, analytics dashboards, internal data or technical products)
  • Ability to utilize user insights, data or analysis to inform decisions
  • Self-motivated and driven to solve problems 
  • 2+ years of experience in a software product management role, preferably a B2B software company. Experience as a developer or analyst is a plus.
  • Demonstrated success developing product vision, strategy and roadmap for a product line.
  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the job done no matter the task, willingness to commit to a fast-paced startup working culture.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, which can be tailored individually for a wide variety of audiences, both internal and external.

About Ordergroove:

  • Raised $50M from top-notch investors
  • Remote-first team with members all over the world and an office in NYC that allows for in-person meet-ups if desired
  • Hundreds of customers including Honest Company, IL MAKIAGE, PetSmart, Wal-mart, L’Oreal, Unilever, Peet’s Coffee, KIND, Love Wellness, and Tula

In 2000, subscriptions transformed the software world with SaaS. In 2021, subscriptions are transforming the retail and DTC world as the fastest-growing segment of commerce. 

Ordergroove’s SaaS product enables subscription experiences for hundreds of brands including The Honest Company, IL MAKIAGE, KIND Snacks, Peet's Coffee, L'Oreal, and Home Depot, shifting consumer interactions from one-and-done transactions to frictionless recurring revenue relationships. Via partnerships with leading eCommerce platforms like Shopify, Salesforce, Adobe Magento, and BigCommerce, Ordergroove's omni-channel product coupled with machine learning has processed billions of dollars in subscription volume for tens of millions of consumers.

Recently named one of the Best Companies to Work For in New York for the third year in a row, our values celebrate collaboration, different perspectives, and curiosity with the goal of getting to the right answer, no matter who came up with it. At Ordergroove we are committed to creating a welcoming and supportive environment for all people. We encourage people with different backgrounds and experiences to join our growing team so that we gain different perspectives and build the best team possible. We demand the best of ourselves and each other and never miss an opportunity to celebrate our successes.

With a fully flexible work from anywhere culture, staying connected and supporting each other are always top of mind. We build our tight-knit community through small group events like trivia night, cooking classes, and book clubs. We encourage cross-functional relationships through virtual coffees and we stay close to the business through weekly team updates and quarterly all-hands meetings.  

At Ordergroove, we focus on flexibility and empowering our team to make the right decisions for themselves. We have flexible PTO (you take vacation when you need it, not when you have earned the hours), a new work-from-anywhere policy (totally remote anywhere in the US, or you can go into the NYC office as much as you would like), and an annual personal development budget that you use for what matters to you (wellness, career development, productivity at home, etc). And of course, that is on top of the basics like competitive compensation (including stock options) and incredible, affordable benefits. Come join our amazing team while we enable the fastest-growing segment of commerce that makes life easier for millions of consumers every day!

At Ordergroove, we want to hire, develop and retain the best talent, making Ordergroove a top destination to grow your career.

The pay transparency law is a way of narrowing the gender pay gap and fostering an engaged and positive working environment.  It is also a way to share what we think is a reasonable, equitable and competitive compensation structure for the roles on our team.

The base salary for this role ranges between $110,000 and $125,000
